newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian bonds rebound, spreads tighten.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian bonds rebound, spreads tighten.

text.p: Australian bonds rebounded from Tuesday's sharp sell-off causing spreads to other dollar bloc bonds to narrow after yesterday's blow-out, traders said.
A recovery in the U.S. market and still positive local fundamentals saw domestic bonds bounce back, although the 10-year spread remains well above Monday's 115 basis point low.

Trading conditions are expected to remain lively over the next few days in the run-up to Friday's key U.S. non-farm payrolls report and as markets globally watch developments in the U.S./Iraq conflict unfold.
Politcal uncertainty in New Zealand in the run-up to its October 12 election continued to weigh on the market there and saw N.Z./Australian spreads widen sharply.
